title: (x) movie type "It's Alive II", 1978 - ITC Serif {Marc O}
content:
Any IDs, digital or otherwise, on this movie title will be much appreciated. It needs to be recreated. Thanks.   
   
 ![Movie title](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124515im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32436.gif)
author: alyce

comments.content: Thanks Mike, I was hoping this would be a font!

Actually, I think it's ITC Serif Gothic with a customized E.   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-serif-gothic/bold/testdrive.html?s=IT%27S+ALIVE+2&p=72](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124515/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-serif-gothic/bold/testdrive.html?s=IT%27S%2BALIVE%2B2&p=72)
I agree with Marc, I remember back then there were alternate characters that I bet didn't get digitalized, like that cap E. I think the 2 gives it away.

I agree too. The E fooled me -- I saw similar shapes and said that's it. Here's the proof. Good eye Marc.   
 ![Alive samples](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124515im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32446.gif)
The original ITC Serif Gothic had alternate characters including the round E.

Yves and Stephen, I know you've marked this thread as closed, but just want to catch up with my posts and pass on a quick thanks for the ITC Serif Gothic ID and info...   
   
_quick thanks_
